thread.title: Gordie Bishop guilty of dragging cop with car after pub break-in
thread.title_full: Gordie Bishop guilty of dragging cop with car after pub break-in

author: cbc
title: Gordie Bishop guilty of dragging cop with car after pub break-in
text:
Gordie Bishop, accused of dragging a Royal Newfoundland Constabulary officer with his car after breaking into Peter Easton Pub, has been found guilty of aggravated assault on a police officer and break and enter.
Gordie Bishop to stand trial for allegedly dragging RNC officer Gordon Bishop arrested in St. John's RNC still seeking Gordon Bishop for Peter Easton Pub break in Bishop, 32, was charged with aggravated assault of a peace officer, assaulting a peace officer with a weapon, break and enter and several other charges following an incident in St. John's in January 2015.
The Supreme Court of Newfoundland and Labrador was told during Bishop's trial that a RNC officer attempted to stop him after the break in, but he drove off.
The female officer, who had reached into the car through the passenger door, was dragged to the intersection of Cookstown Road and LeMarchant Road before she fell out, hitting her head.
RNC officer dragged by car unable to positively ID man charged with assaulting her During her testimony at Bishop's trial in early February, Const. Cathy Snelgrove said she was working as dispatcher because she's not physically ready to go back on patrol.
Gordon Bishop 32 has been found guilty of aggravated assault on a police officer and b & e into Peter Eastons Pub. Officer dragged. #cbcnl pic.twitter.com/PbH5xTZGuE
â€” @glenn_payette In total, Bishop faced 13 charges from that day. He was convicted of six, while two of the charges were dismissed.
Some of the remaining charges were stayed because they were similar to the ones for which he was found guilty.
Bishop is in custody and will be back in court April 18 for sentencing.
